trans-unit.source: Provides a unified way of converting types of values to other types, as well as for accessing standard values and subproperties.
The most common type of converter is one that converts to and from a text representation.
The type converter for a class is bound to the class with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute>.
Unless this attribute is overridden, all classes that inherit from this class use the same type converter as the base class.
> [!NOTE] > For general type system purposes, do not access a type converter directly.
Instead, access the appropriate converter by using <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
For more information, see the code examples provided.
**Note** For XAML purposes, a XAML processor searches for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> directly, instead of going through <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.

For cases where you do want a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> instance from code, or where you create a shared instance in WPF resources, it is acceptable to construct it directly without referencing <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> or other reflection and type system support.

Classes derived from TypeConverter are often referenced as part of how a XAML processor converts an attribute or initialization text value from markup (which is inherently a string) and generates an object for a run-time representation.
Custom type authors that intend to support a type conversion behavior for XAML typically implement a TypeConverter class that supports their own unique `ConvertFrom` behavior from a string.

This behavior enables type conversion from the string provided as a XAML attribute value and provides a XAML processor with the support needed to create an object from the string, so that the object can be produced in a parsed object graph.

Custom types or members of custom types are indicated by applying <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> to the definitions, with the attribute referencing the custom TypeConverter implementation.
For more information, see [Type Converters for XAML Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> class.
Returns whether this converter can convert an object of the given type to the type of this converter.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
It never returns `true`.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you want to convert from.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this converter can convert an object of the given type to the type of this converter, using the specified context.
As implemented in this class, this method returns `false`, unless `sourceType` is an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor>.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you want to convert from.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this converter can convert the object to the specified type.
If `destinationType` is a string, the default implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertTo%2A> always returns `true`.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you want to convert to.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this converter can convert the object to the specified type, using the specified context.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
If `destinationType` is a string, the default implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertTo%2A> always returns `true`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type you want to convert to.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Converts the given value to the type of this converter.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given object to the type of this converter, using the specified context and culture information.
Custom type authors that intend to support a type conversion behavior for XAML typically implement a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> class that supports ConvertFrom behavior from a string.

This behavior enables type conversion from the string provided as a XAML attribute value and provides a XAML processor with the support needed to create an object from the string, so that the object can be produced in a parsed object graph.

Custom types or members of custom types are indicated by applying <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> to the definitions, with the attribute referencing the custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> implementation.
For XAML purposes, you do not typically provide branching implementations based on `culture`.
This is because XAML is precompiled in a development environment context, and culture-specific information for runtime XAML is not relevant for XAML type conversion.
For more information, see [Type Converters for XAML Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> to use as the current culture.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given string to the type of this converter, using the invariant culture.
The default implementation always returns `null`.
The <xref:System.String> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted text.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given string to the type of this converter, using the invariant culture and the specified context.
An exception is raised if the string cannot be converted into the appropriate object.
The default implementation always returns `null`.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref:System.String> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted text.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the specified text to an object.
The default implementation always returns `null`.
The text representation of the object to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted text.
The string cannot be converted into the appropriate object.
Converts the given text to an object, using the specified context.
An exception is raised if the string cannot be converted into the appropriate object.
The default implementation always returns `null`.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref:System.String> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted text.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given text to an object, using the specified context and culture information.
An exception is raised if the string cannot be converted into the appropriate object.
The default implementation always returns `null`.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is passed, the current culture is assumed.
The <xref:System.String> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted text.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given value object to the specified type, using the arguments.
The most common type to convert to and from is a string object.
This implementation calls <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> on the object, if the object is valid and if the destination type is a string.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
The <xref:System.Type> to convert the `value` parameter to.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The destinationType parameter is .
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given value object to the specified type, using the specified context and culture information.
The most common types to convert are to and from a string object.
This implementation calls <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> on the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is a string.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

Custom type authors that intend to support a type conversion behavior for XAML typically implement a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> class that supports <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> behavior from a string.
These type converters might also implement ConvertTo to support serialization back to XAML.
Some XAML serialization scenarios cannot be adequately addressed with <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> alone.
In these cases, it may be necessary to also define a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer> that handles the serialization cases that would otherwise be handled by ConvertTo.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer>.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is passed, the current culture is assumed.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
The <xref:System.Type> to convert the `value` parameter to.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The destinationType parameter is .
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the specified value to a culture-invariant string representation.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
Depending on the implementation of the value formatter, it might be possible to pass the returned string back into the value formatter to re-create an instance of the object.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
A <xref:System.String> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the specified value to a culture-invariant string representation, using the specified context.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
Depending on the implementation of the value formatter, it might be possible to pass the returned string back into the value formatter to re-create an instance of the object.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
A <xref:System.String> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the specified value to a string representation.
Depending on the implementation of the value formatter, it might be possible to pass the returned string back into the value formatter to re-create an instance of the object.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given value to a string representation, using the given context.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
Depending on the implementation of the value formatter, it might be possible to pass the returned string back into the value formatter to re-create an instance of the object.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given value to a string representation, using the specified context and culture information.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
Depending on the implementation of the value formatter, it might be possible to pass the returned string back into the value formatter to re-create an instance of the object.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is passed, the current culture is assumed.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Re-creates an <xref:System.Object> given a set of property values for the object.
Use this method for objects that are immutable, but for which you want to provide changeable properties.
The dictionary provided by the `propertyValues` parameter has a series of name/value pairs, one for each property returned from <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetProperties%2A>.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> that represents a dictionary of new property values.
An <xref:System.Object> representing the given <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object cannot be created.
This method always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Creates an instance of the type that this <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> is associated with, using the specified context, given a set of property values for the object.
Use this method for objects that are immutable, but for which you want to provide changeable properties.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of new property values.
An <xref:System.Object> representing the given <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object cannot be created.
This method always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Returns an exception to throw when a conversion cannot be performed.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object is not available.
An <xref:System.Exception> that represents the exception to throw when a conversion cannot be performed.
Automatically thrown by this method.
Returns an exception to throw when a conversion cannot be performed.
The <xref:System.Object> to convert, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the object is not available.
A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type the conversion was trying to convert to.
An <xref:System.Exception> that represents the exception to throw when a conversion cannot be performed.
Automatically thrown by this method.
Returns whether changing a value on this object requires a call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CreateInstance*> method to create a new value.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if changing a property on this object requires a call to <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CreateInstance*> to create a new value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether changing a value on this object requires a call to <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CreateInstance*> to create a new value, using the specified context.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if changing a property on this object requires a call to <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CreateInstance*> to create a new value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a collection of properties for the type of array specified by the value parameter.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `null`.
By default, a type does not return properties.
An easy implementation of this method can call <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> for the correct data type.
An <xref:System.Object> that specifies the type of array for which to get properties.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> with the properties that are exposed for this data type, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there are no properties.
Returns a collection of properties for the type of array specified by the value parameter, using the specified context.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `null`.
By default, a type does not return properties.
An easy implementation of this method can call <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties%2A> for the correct data type.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An <xref:System.Object> that specifies the type of array for which to get properties.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> with the properties that are exposed for this data type, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there are no properties.
Returns a collection of properties for the type of array specified by the value parameter, using the specified context and attributes.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An <xref:System.Object> that specifies the type of array for which to get properties.
An array of type <xref:System.Attribute> that is used as a filter.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> with the properties that are exposed for this data type, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if there are no properties.
Returns whether this object supports properties.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetProperties*> should be called to find the properties of this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this object supports properties, using the specified context.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetProperties*> should be called to find the properties of this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a collection of standard values from the default context for the data type this type converter is designed for.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `null`.

A <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> containing a standard set of valid values, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data type does not support a standard set of values.
Returns a collection of standard values for the data type this type converter is designed for when provided with a format context.
As implemented in <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter>, this method always returns `null`.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context that can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter or properties of this parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

A <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> that holds a standard set of valid values, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the data type does not support a standard set of values.
Returns whether the collection of standard values returned from <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues*> is an exclusive list.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
If the list is exclusive, such as in an enumeration data type, then no other values are valid.
If the list is not exclusive, then other valid values might exist in addition to the list of standard values that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method provides.
If the values are exclusive, the list returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> should not allow these values to be edited.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> returned from <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues*> is an exhaustive list of possible values; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if other values are possible.
Returns whether the collection of standard values returned from <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues*> is an exclusive list of possible values, using the specified context.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
If the list is exclusive, such as in an enumeration data type, then no other values are valid.
If the list is not exclusive, then other valid values might exist in addition to the list of standard values that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method provides.
If the values are exclusive, the list returned by <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> should not allow these values to be edited.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> returned from <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues*> is an exhaustive list of possible values; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if other values are possible.
Returns whether this object supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues*> should be called to find a common set of values the object supports; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether this object supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list, using the specified context.
As implemented in this class, this method always returns `false`.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues*> should be called to find a common set of values the object supports; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether the given value object is valid for this type.

Starting in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/add/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.IsValid%2A> method catches exceptions from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> methods.

If the input value type causes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> to return `false`, or if the input value causes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> to raise an exception, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.IsValid%2A> method returns `false`.
To enable the legacy behavior, insert the following lines into the configuration file of the application, for example, application1.exe.config.
The object to test for validity.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified value is valid for this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns whether the given value object is valid for this type and for the specified context.
Use the `context` parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked.
This parameter can be `null`, so always check it.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

Starting in [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/add/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the IsValid method catches exceptions from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> methods.

If the input value type causes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> to return `false`, or if the input value causes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> to raise an exception, the IsValid method returns `false`.
To enable the legacy behavior, insert the following lines into the configuration file of the application, for example, application1.exe.config.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref:System.Object> to test for validity.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified value is valid for this object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Sorts a collection of properties.
All properties in the collection that are not already in the array of names are added alphabetically to the end.
If the `names` parameter is an empty array or `null`, all the properties in the collection are sorted alphabetically.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that has the properties to sort.
An array of names in the order you want the properties to appear in the collection.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that contains the sorted properties.
